qas.question: What has the color of the Arsenal  home shirts been?
In recognition of what event was the color red adopted for Arsenal shirts?
Which founding members were responsible for the red shirts?
What was the early name for the Arsenal FC?
What was the color  of the early uniforms' shorts and socks?
What color are Arsenal players shoes?
What color were Forest players shirts?
In what year was Nottingham Forest's football team founded?
In what year did Fred Beardsley first play for Forest?
In what year did Morris Bates stop playing for Forest?

context: For much of Arsenal's history, their home colours have been <a0_0><b5_0>bright red<b5_0/><a0_0/> shirts with <b6_0>white<b6_0/> sleeves and white shorts, though this has not always been the case. The choice of red is in recognition of a <a1_0>charitable donation<a1_0/> from Nottingham Forest, soon after Arsenal's foundation in <b7_0><b8_0><b9_0>1886<b9_0/><b8_0/><b7_0/>. Two of <a3_0>Dial Square<a3_0/>'s founding members, <a2_0>Fred Beardsley and Morris Bates<a2_0/>, were former Forest players who had moved to Woolwich for work. As they put together the first team in the area, no kit could be found, so Beardsley and Bates wrote home for help and received a set of kit and a ball. The shirt was redcurrant, a dark shade of red, and was worn with <a4_0>white<a4_0/> shorts and socks with blue and white hoops.
